Index.supportedFiles: Supported file types are MP3, WAV, or M4A. Audio files will be encoded up to 128kbps MP3s and the file size cannot exceed 1GB. Variable bit rate files under 128 kbps are not supported.

Index.tooltipMessage: Ensure that you uploaded your podcast
Index.fileUploadTooltipMessage: You can upload your podcast here, please ensure that the file type is compatible with the type you selected in the previous step.
Index.offlineMessage: You are offline. The upload will resume once the connection is restored.
Index.episodes-page-description: Find all of your drafts and episodes in the tabs below. When a draft is assigned a Publish Date and an audio file, it will automatically be moved to the Episodes tab and go live on its assigned date.
Index.To access your RSS feed, please: To access your RSS feed, please
Index.main-distribution-channels-description-1: Some of the distribution channels below will automatically find your RSS feed and update them. Make sure your show is on the channels you want by explicitly setting them up with our distribution tools.
Index.main-distribution-channels-description-2: Most podcast platforms and hosting providers require an owner email or verification code to submit your show. They are hidden from your RSS feed by default, edit these settings in your
Index.typeAndPressSpace: Type and press space to add a new favorite list
Index.addToFavoritesTooltip: Click to add to your favorite lists
Index.PublishPodcastsAndYouCanSeeTheirStatisti: Publish podcasts and you can see their statistics here
Index.the-audience-overview-has-the-at-a-glanc: The Audience Overview has the at-a-glance analytics you need to start understanding your show’s performance

category.description: At least one category is required to create your show. These are used by podcast apps, like Apple Podcasts to categorize the show for listeners to discover.

Index.an-overview-of-your-youtube-chanel-perfo: An overview of your YouTube chanel performance regarding this show.
Index.get_started: Let’s get started by adding a show
Index.get_started_description: Whether you’re starting from scratch or importing from another platform, we’ve got you covered
Index.publish-episode-description: In order to submit and publish your Show, you must first publish an episode
Index.show-episodes-description: Manage and view all your episodes for this show
Index.submit-show-description: To allow listeners to enjoy your show, submit your feed to Apple Podcasts, Spotify, and more
Index.episodicDescription: This is the default format with episodes presented and recommended from newest-to-oldest. This option is recommended for stand-alone episodes.
Index.episodicSeasonsDescription: For Shows with episodes presented and recommended newest-to-oldest and grouped by seasons. This option is recommended for stand-alone episodes.
Index.serialDescription: For Shows with episodes presented and recommended oldest-to-newest and grouped by seasons. This option is recommended for narrative and storytelling formats.
Index.categoryDescription: Choose up to three categories that best describe your show.
Index.tagsDescription: Hit enter or separate tags with commas.
Index.authorsDescription: Add the podcast author’s names to be credited with the content of your podcast. This will be displayed in podcast listening apps.
Index.there-are-no-drafts-fot-this-show: There are no drafts fot this show
Index.select-a-chat-or-start-a-new-conversatio: Select a chat or start a new conversation
Index.to-start-a-conversation-you-should-have-: To start a chat you should have an accepted request first, then a chat with the related user will be opened automatically.
Index.there-is-no-messages-in-this-chat-yet: There is no messages in this chat yet
Index.you-can-start-a-conversation-with-this: You can start a conversation with this
